measles.name: Measles
measles.description: Measles is a highly contagious infectious disease caused by measles virus.

pneumonia.name: Pneumonia
pneumonia.description: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs.

tuberculosis.name: Tuberculosis
tuberculosis.description: Tuberculosis is a disease caused by germs that are spread from person to person through the air.

leprosy.name: Leprosy
leprosy.description: It is a chronic infectious disease which is caused by a type of bacteria called Mycobacterium leprae.

dysentry.name: Dysentry
dysentry.description: Dysentery is an infection of the intestines that causes diarrhoea containing blood or mucus.

malaria.name: Malaria
malaria.description: Malaria is a life-threatening disease caused by parasites that are transmitted to people through the bites of infected female Anopheles mosquitoes.

diphtheria.name: Diphtheria
diphtheria.description: Diphtheria is a serious infection caused by strains of bacteria called Corynebacterium diphtheriae that make toxin.

flu.name: Flu
flu.description: Flu (influenza) is an infection of the nose, throat and lungs, which are part of the respiratory system.

Typhoid.name: Typhpid
Typhoid.description: Typhoid fever is a bacterial infection that can spread throughout the body, affecting many organs.

smallpox.name: Smallpox
smallpox.description: Smallpox was an infectious disease caused by variola virus (often called smallpox virus) which belongs to the genus Orthopoxvirus.

cholera.name: Cholera
cholera.description: Cholera is an acute diarrheal illness caused by infection of the intestine with Vibrio cholerae bacteria.

anthrax.name: Anthrax
anthrax.description: Anthrax is a serious infectious disease caused by gram-positive, rod-shaped bacteria known as Bacillus anthracis.

commonCold.name: Common cold
commonCold.description: The common cold is a viral infection of nose and throat (upper respiratory tract).
